short for
turbocharger : a small turbine turned by the waste gases from an engine that pushes the fuel and air mixture into the engine at a higher pressure, increasing the power produced by the engine: The newer model has more power, but without a turbo.
a vehicle that has an engine with a turbocharger: This latest model is a turbo. Related word
turbocharge
More examplesFewer examplesThe performance is improved dramatically by the addition of a turbo on the GXP model. The two of them were talking about turbos and cams and horsepower. This news is like a booster in our back, a big turbo, that I think can help what we're doing.

used to describe an engine or machine in which power is produced by a turbine: It was a very efficient turbo diesel engine. The company owns a fleet of 10 turbo jets. They used turbo heaters on the building site.
informal very big, powerful, etc.: He's gone out to a turbo lunch. I call them turbo beauty products because they transform the surface of your skin.
